speaker: OCTAVIUS
text_entry: SCENE II. Camp near Sardis. Before BRUTUS's tent.

speaker: OCTAVIUS
text_entry: Drum. Enter BRUTUS, LUCILIUS, LUCIUS, and Soldiers; TITINIUS and PINDARUS meeting them

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Stand, ho!

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: Give the word, ho! and stand.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: What now, Lucilius! is Cassius near?

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: He is at hand; and Pindarus is come

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: To do you salutation from his master.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: He greets me well. Your master, Pindarus,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: In his own change, or by ill officers,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Hath given me some worthy cause to wish

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Things done, undone: but, if he be at hand,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: I shall be satisfied.

speaker: PINDARUS
text_entry: I do not doubt

speaker: PINDARUS
text_entry: But that my noble master will appear

speaker: PINDARUS
text_entry: Such as he is, full of regard and honour.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: He is not doubted. A word, Lucilius;

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: How he received you, let me be resolved.

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: With courtesy and with respect enough;

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: But not with such familiar instances,

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: Nor with such free and friendly conference,

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: As he hath used of old.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Thou hast described

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: A hot friend cooling: ever note, Lucilius,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: When love begins to sicken and decay,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: It useth an enforced ceremony.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: There are no tricks in plain and simple faith;

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: But hollow men, like horses hot at hand,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Make gallant show and promise of their mettle;

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: But when they should endure the bloody spur,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: They fall their crests, and, like deceitful jades,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Sink in the trial. Comes his army on?

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: They mean this night in Sardis to be quarter'd;

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: The greater part, the horse in general,

speaker: LUCILIUS
text_entry: Are come with Cassius.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Hark! he is arrived.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Low march within

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: March gently on to meet him.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Enter CASSIUS and his powers

speaker: CASSIUS
text_entry: Stand, ho!

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Stand, ho! Speak the word along.

speaker: First Soldier
text_entry: Stand!

speaker: Second Soldier
text_entry: Stand!

speaker: Third Soldier
text_entry: Stand!

speaker: CASSIUS
text_entry: Most noble brother, you have done me wrong.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Judge me, you gods! wrong I mine enemies?

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: And, if not so, how should I wrong a brother?

speaker: CASSIUS
text_entry: Brutus, this sober form of yours hides wrongs;

speaker: CASSIUS
text_entry: And when you do them--

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Cassius, be content.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Speak your griefs softly: I do know you well.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Before the eyes of both our armies here,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Which should perceive nothing but love from us,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Let us not wrangle: bid them move away;

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Then in my tent, Cassius, enlarge your griefs,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: And I will give you audience.

speaker: CASSIUS
text_entry: Pindarus,

speaker: CASSIUS
text_entry: Bid our commanders lead their charges off

speaker: CASSIUS
text_entry: A little from this ground.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Lucilius, do you the like; and let no man

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Come to our tent till we have done our conference.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Let Lucius and Titinius guard our door.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Exeunt
